帹字的基本解释

帹
shà
〔帹暆（
sh?）〕古代覆盖头、面的巾帕。

帹
qiè
古代男子束发的巾。

帹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shà］
［《廣韻》所甲切，入狎，生。］
覆盖头面的巾帕。
[②]［qiè］
［《集韻》七接切，入葉，清。］
裹束头发用的巾。

帹字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【巾字部】　帹； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页333第15
【類篇】色甲切，音翣。【玉篇】帹，施面衣也。　又【類篇】七接切，音妾。幧頭。【廣雅】㒾?謂之帹帞。

帹字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
帹字的起名意思

暂无。

Silk
Basic explanation of words
Silk
shà
〔帹暆(
sh?)] An ancient kerchief covering the head and face.
Silk
qiè
An ancient man's hair scarf.
Silk
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shà］
[A cut in "Guangyun", enters 狎, and is born. ]
A kerchief covering the head.
[②]［qiè］
["Ji Yun" seven consecutive cuts, into the leaves, Qing. ]
Towels used to wrap hair.
Silk
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Collection] [Scarf Character Department] 　帹; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 333 No. 15
【Classes】The color is cut, and the sound is bang. [Jade articles] silk, face clothes also.　[Classes] Seven cuts, sound concubine. Shatou. [Guang Ya] 㒾? That is the silk.
Silk
